content: Hi, I made a comment on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73078, but I'm not sure if comments on closed issues are seen. Some auto-generated files with ![cfg_attr(rustfmt, rustfmt_skip)] are getting formatted by rustfmt after upgrading to 1.45.0. As far as I can tell from the release notes, that was not intentional. Is there something I'm missing?

I cannot fix your problem with rustfmt but I can tell you that comments on closed issues are seen by anyone subscribed to the issue. By default it doesn't un-subscribe people when the issue closes, so basically all the same people will see your comment.
I would file a new issue regardless, perhaps on the rustfmt repo. Maybe we missed a beta backport or something?
did we miss one of the 1.44.1 fixes?
This topic was moved here from #general > rustfmt in 1.45.0 by simulacrum
This topic was moved by simulacrum to #t-release > rustfmt in 1.45.0
This topic was moved here from #general > rustfmt in 1.45.0 by simulacrum
uh, maybe a bit excessive there bot
For reference, I filed https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/74443. Thanks for looking into this!
